data.event: The Kingdom of Van was established in 860 BC and by the 6th century BC it was replaced by the Satrapy of Armenia.
The Kingdom of Van was established in 860 BC and by the 6th century BC it was replaced by the Satrapy of Armenia.

event.title: 1st century BC the Kingdom of Armenia reached

data.event: In the 1st century BC the Kingdom of Armenia reached its height under Tigranes the Great.

event.title: years of the 4th century, the state became

data.event: In between the late 3rd century to early years of the 4th century, the state became the first Christian nation.
Declining due to the wars against the Byzantines, the kingdom fell in 1045 and Armenia was soon after invaded by the Seljuk Turks.

event.title: was located on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea between the 11th and 14th centuries

data.event: An Armenian principality and later a kingdom Cilician Armenia was located on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea between the 11th and 14th centuries.
